Bacterialblight: Use copper-based bactericides such as copper sulfate. Spray during the early stages of infection. Avoid over-irrigation and ensure good water drainage.
Blast: Apply fungicides like Tricyclazole or Isoprothiolane. Use disease-resistant varieties and avoid dense planting to reduce humidity.
Brownspot: Use fungicides like Mancozeb. Ensure balanced plant nutrition, especially potassium. Avoid drought stress and excessive nitrogen.
Tungro: There is no direct cure for Tungro virus. Use resistant rice varieties and control insect vectors like green leafhoppers using insecticides such as Imidacloprid.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot: Apply copper-based bactericides or antibiotics like Streptomycin. Remove and destroy infected leaves. Avoid overhead watering to reduce moisture.
Tomato___Early_blight: Use fungicides such as Chlorothalonil or Mancozeb. Practice crop rotation and ensure proper plant spacing for good airflow.
Tomato___Late_blight: Treat with fungicides like Metalaxyl or Dimethomorph. Remove infected leaves immediately and avoid high humidity environments.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold: Improve greenhouse ventilation and apply fungicides like Mancozeb. Reduce moisture around the plants.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot: Use fungicides such as Chlorothalonil. Remove affected leaves and avoid overhead irrigation to prevent spreading.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider: Apply miticides such as Abamectin. Spray plants with strong water jets to reduce mites. Introduce beneficial predatory insects if possible.
Tomato___Target_Spot: Apply fungicides like Azoxystrobin. Remove infected leaves and maintain proper spacing between plants for better air circulation.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus: There is no direct treatment. Remove and destroy infected plants. Use certified virus-free seeds and avoid handling infected plants.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus: Control the whitefly vector using insecticides such as Imidacloprid. Use resistant tomato varieties and insect-proof nets.
